articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as New Zealand play South Africa in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: New Zealand v South Africa - clips, radio & text

articles.description: Reaction to England's defeat by Belgium as Scotland and Wales also lose and Northern Ireland draw, plus EFL Cup news.
articles.title: Women's Nations League reaction as England lose

articles.description: England bowler David Willey will retire from international cricket at the end of the World Cup aged 33.
articles.title: Willey to retire from England duty after World Cup

articles.description: Australia batter Glenn Maxwell will miss Saturday's World Cup match against England after falling off the back of a golf buggy and suffering a concussion.
articles.title: Maxwell out of England match after golf buggy fall

articles.description: England's defeat in Belgium leaves qualification for the Olympic Games in doubt as their weaknesses are exposed yet again.
articles.title: Lionesses exposed as Olympics qualification in doubt

articles.description: Spain head coach Montse Tome says a "computer error" prevented Irene Paredes from making her 100th international appearance on Tuesday.
articles.title: Paredes denied 100th Spain cap by 'computer error'

articles.description: Mercedes chief technical officer Mike Elliott leaves the team after 11 years following a disappointing 2023 campaign.
articles.title: Chief technical officer Elliott leaves Mercedes

articles.description: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz sees his hopes of finishing the year as the world number one damaged by a shock opening loss to Roman Safiullin in the Paris Masters.
articles.title: Below-par Alcaraz stunned in early Paris exit

articles.description: When Brenner Woolley, the man who has commentated on more than 1,000 Ipswich Town games for BBC Radio Suffolk, says this is "the happiest I've ever known" the club, it isn't just hyperbole.
articles.title: TV on a golf buggy & Man Utd effect - inside McKenna's Ipswich

articles.description: The San Antonio Spurs score four points in the final six seconds to claim a thrilling 115-114 win at the Phoenix Suns.
articles.title: Spurs mount dramatic comeback to beat Suns
